tasks.task: Farmer discussing wintering cattle on fodder beet and improving water quality through grazing management.
subtasks: Farmer describes wintering Frisian bulls on fodder beet.
Farmer explains the importance of carrying feed through winter using fodder beet.
Farmer discusses the Pomahake catchment project and water quality improvements.
Farmer explains the grazing management system of grazing paddocks from top to bottom to reduce sediment runoff.
Farmer discusses the benefits of leaving a buffer zone of ungrazed grass near waterways.
Farmer highlights the importance of planning grazing rotations to prevent sediment loss during rainfall events.
Farmer emphasizes the need for all farmers, especially cattle farmers, to adopt improved grazing practices to reduce water quality issues.
